intro: Puelia dewevrei, commonly known as the Florida marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Puelia dewevrei is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
